title: OneVentures powers up new tech fund raising
text:
One of the bigwigs of the local venture capital scene, OneVentures, has started preparing investors for a new growth fund targeting late-stage technology and technology-enabled companies.

Street Talk understands OneVentures is set to launch a $100 million to $200 million fundraising for a new fund that would target $20 million-odd investments for controlling or substantial minority stakes.

The new fund is expected to be run by OneVentures managing partner Michelle Deaker and partner Grant Chamberlain, and will target companies looking for access to growth capital or liquidity for founders.

Managing partner Michelle Deaker at OneVentures is expected to oversee a new growth fund. Peter Braig

It is expected to pitch its stake in SaaS company Employment Hero as proof of its credentials in the sector. OneVentures led a Series A funding round for Employment Hero in 2016, and the company recently achieved a $100 million-plus valuation when it raised fresh funds from investors including SEEK as part of a Series C deal.

OneVentures is one of the country's biggest venture capital managers with $400 million in assets under management across its four funds. The firm invests across the technology and healthcare sectors.
description: One of the bigwigs of the local venture capital scene, OneVentures, is preparing investors for a new growth fund.
